headline: FedEx Announces Pricing of FedEx Freight’s $3.7 Billion Offering of Senior Notes in Connection with Planned Spin-Off
summary: MEMPHIS, Tenn., January 27, 2026--FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX) ("FedEx") announced today that FedEx Freight Holding Company, Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of FedEx (the "Issuer"), has priced a private offering of $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.300% senior notes due 2029, $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.650% senior notes due 2031, $700,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.950% senior notes due 2033 and $1,000,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 5.250% senior notes

headline: UPS won’t resurrect MD-11 fleet after deadly crash, takes $137M charge
summary: UPS has accelerated the retirement of its MD-11 freighter fleet because they will likely require extensive repairs to make them airworthy following a fatal crash and there are newer planes in the delivery pipeline. The post UPS won’t resurrect MD-11 fleet after deadly crash, takes $137M charge appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: New Owner of 32-Year-Old Pak Mail in Alpharetta, Georgia Seeks to Build Her Business with Shipping and Office Services
summary: Annex Brands, Inc., a leading franchisor in the packing, shipping, and office services industries, is pleased to announce the successful transfer of ownership of an existing Pak Mail location in Alpharetta, GA to new owner, Kuana Miles. This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will continue to benefit from the essential shipping and office services from this Pak Mail for the last 32 years.

raw.headline: New Owner of 32-Year-Old Pak Mail in Alpharetta, Georgia Seeks to Build Her Business with Shipping and Office Services

This transition to new ownership ensures that the community will continue to benefit from the essential shipping and office services from this Pak Mail for the last 32 years.

headline: FedEx Appoints Scott Ray as Chief Operating Officer for U.S. and Canada Surface Operations
summary: MEMPHIS, Tenn., January 27, 2026--FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX) today announced the appointment of Scott Ray as chief operating officer for U.S. and Canada Surface Operations, effective June 1. He will begin transitioning into the role as COO-elect on Feb. 1. Reporting to FedEx President and CEO Raj Subramaniam, Ray will be the newest member of the FedEx Executive Committee, succeeding John Smith, who will transition to CEO of FedEx Freight as of June 1.

raw.headline: FedEx Appoints Scott Ray as Chief Operating Officer for U.S. and Canada Surface Operations

He will begin transitioning into the role as COO-elect on Feb. 1. Reporting to FedEx President and CEO Raj Subramaniam, Ray will be the newest member of the FedEx Executive Committee, succeeding John Smith, who will transition to CEO of FedEx Freight as of June 1.

headline: UPS forecasts upbeat 2026 revenue on shift to higher-value shipments
summary: Jan 27 () - United Parcel Service forecast higher annual revenue ​on Tuesday, as it ‌reduces low-margin deliveries for its biggest ‌customer, Amazon, and shifts toward higher-paying shipments. The world's largest package delivery company expects 2026 revenue to ⁠be $89.

headline: Is It Time To Reassess FedEx (FDX) After Strong Multi Year Share Price Gains?
summary: Many investors are wondering whether FedEx, at around US$304 a share, offers good value today, and are rechecking the numbers to see if the current price still makes sense. The stock’s recent moves, including a 1.2% decline over the last 7 days, a 2.7% gain over 30 days, and returns of 3.9% year to date and 10.7% over 1 year, keep raising questions about what is already priced in after the 76.4% 3 year and 40.1% 5 year returns. Recent headlines around FedEx have focused on its role in global...
